meanings.definition: A threadlike structure of nucleic acids and protein found in the nucleus of most living cells, carrying genetic information in the form of genes.
meanings.sent1: The chromosomes in our cells determine our inherited traits.
meanings.sent2: During cell division, chromosomes replicate to ensure each new cell has the correct genetic material.
meanings.sent3: I heard a joke that the chromosomes in the cell had a dance party, but the genes were too shy to join in!
meanings.sent4: The chromosomes are like a library catalog, organizing all the genetic information for the cell.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the chromosomes look like tiny, twisted threads holding the secrets of life.

meanings.definition: A single long, continuous thread of DNA that consists of numerous genes and regulatory elements.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study how mutations in chromosomes can lead to genetic disorders.
meanings.sent2: Each species has a specific number of chromosomes that determine its genetic makeup.
meanings.sent3: The chromosomes in the cell were having a race to see which gene would reach the finish line first!
meanings.sent4: In a way, chromosomes are like the chapters of a book, each containing vital information for the cell.
meanings.sent5: The chromosomes hold the blueprint of life, guiding the development and functioning of organisms.
